class KeyManager

Detailed Description

Following KeyMappings are possible:
  • hardware key down to virtual key
  • key down to feature
  • long key down to feature
  • very long key down to feature
  • sequence of hardware key down to feature
See also:
KeyManager

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Member Function Documentation

void KeyMapping::AddKeySequenceFeature (  KeySequence *  sequence,
const FeatureHandle *  feature_handle
) 
 

Define a mapping of KeySequence to FeatureHandle. The KeySequence is defined by sequence of hardware keys.

Parameters:
sequence Hardware key down sequence
feature_handle Mapped feature or context feature

void KeyMapping::AddVKey (  KeyCode  hw_key,
KeyCode  v_key
) 
 

Define a mapping of given hardware key to virtual key

Parameters:
hwKey Hardware key down
vKey Mapped virtual key down

void KeyMapping::AddVKeyFeature (  KeyCode  key,
const FeatureHandle *  feature_handle
) 
 

Define a mapping of a KeyCode to FeatureHandle, the given key code can be a virtual or hardware key.

Parameters:
vKey key down
feature_handle Mapped feature or context feature

const FeatureHandle *  feature_handle
) 
 

Define a mapping of long key down to FeatureHandle

feature_handle Mapped feature or context feature

const FeatureHandle *  feature_handle
) 
 

Defines a mapping of very long key down to FeatureHandle.

Parameters:
hwKey Hardware very long key down
feature_handle Mapped feature or context feature

const FeatureHandle * KeyMapping::GetFeature (  KeyCode  key  )  const
 

Returns a FeatureHandle to the given Key If no FeatureHandle is mapped to the given KeyCode 0 is returned.

const FeatureHandle * KeyMapping::GetLongFeature (  KeyCode  key  )  const
 

Returns a FeatureHandle to the given KeyCode. If a Feature is mapped to the given KeyCode it may only be executed if LongKeyPressMsg arrives. If no FeatureHandle is mapped to the given KeyCode 0 is returned

const FeatureHandle * KeyMapping::GetSequenceFeature (  KeyCode  key,
BOOLEAN &  consume_last_key
) 
 

Returns the FeatureHande if a KeySequence is finished with the given KeyCode. A FeatureHandle is only returned if the given KeyCode completes a defined KeySequence otherwise 0 is returned.

Parameters:
consume_last_key TRUE means that the last pressed key of the KeySequence should not be routed. AtlApplication::RouteMessage returns TRUE FALSE means that the last pressed key of the KeySequence should be handled and executed as a usual KeyPress.

const FeatureHandle * KeyMapping::GetVeryLongFeature (  KeyCode  key  )  const
 

Returns a FeatureHandle to the given KeyCode. If a Feature is mapped to the given KeyCode it may only be executed if VeryLongKeyPressMsg arrives. If no FeatureHandle is mapped to the given KeyCode 0 is returned.

KeyCode KeyMapping::GetVKey (  KeyCode  hw_key  )  const
 

Return the KeyCode of the mapped virtual key If no virtual key is mapped to the given hardware key 0 is returned.

void KeyMapping::UpdateExpireTime (   )  [static, protected]
 

Notify the keymappings that the time of Sequences has expired. Do this only on every KeyDown Message.
